Text: ALERT: Senate votes TODAY on tax plan. It's a bad deal that will blow up our nat’l debt, increase taxes on many middle-class Americans & lead to millions losing healthcare. Call your senators now & say we need a bipartisan bill that helps all Americans! : (202) 224-3121

This week I joined 17 Dem Senators to tell the Republicans we want to work on reasonable bipartisan tax reform...bring down corporate rates & bring $ back from overseas?  OK, But this bill goes too far, adds too much debt & does too little for middle class. #ComeToTable

All Americans deserve safety and dignity in their senior years. The recent report on physical & sexual abuse of senior citizens in MN nursing homes & assisted-living facilities is extremely troubling. I'm calling for action & solutions.http://strib.mn/2ndUZIT

Senate Republicans say that they are increasing the Child Tax Credit -- but how much of that expansion will really help working families that need it? Answer: Not much.https://www.cbpp.org/research/federal-tax/interactive-millions-of-children-get-less-than-full-benefit-and-in-some-cases …

Good to know that @SenFranken @TimKaine @SenatorBaldwin & others are there to ask the tough questions of HHS nominee Azar in hearing today—prescription drug prices (including insulin under his watch) are sky high today

Left Judiciary for Joint Economic Committee where Chair Yellen is making her last appearance before our Committee.  She has been a strong trusted steady presence at the Federal Reserve and has done good work for our economy and I have truly enjoyed working with her.

We already know that Russia interfered with our 2016 election. In order to ensure that it doesn't happen again Congress must act. My bipartisan bill with @LindseyGrahamSC would be a good place to start. http://www.politico.com/story/2017/11/26/election-cybersecurity-hackers-midterms-259472 …

We need bipartisan fixes to our tax code, not a bill that would blow up the nat'l debt by $1.4 trillion & repeal a key healthcare provision that could cause millions to lose coverage. That's why I joined @Sen_JoeManchin & other colleagues in calling for a bipartisan path forward.

If you want to bring down drug prices, you don’t put a former pharmaceutical company executive in charge of health care policy for our country. I'm voting no.https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/26/us/politics/alex-azar-senate-confirmation-hearing-hhs.html …

Enough.

When prices of the top best-selling drugs are skyrocketing, we cannot afford to put a former pharmaceutical executive in charge of our top health agency.pic.twitter.com/wz6Ik4jj40

Enough. 87% of Americans want to make it easier for generic drugs to be released. Congress must support my bill w @SenatorLeahy to give generic drug manufacturers access to research & my bill w @ChuckGrassley to stop payoffs to generic drug makers to keep products off the market.pic.twitter.com/CTkFuIezq7

Enough. 72% of Americans support the purchase of prescription drugs – with the same dosages & safety standards – imported from Canada. It’s time for Congress to act on my bill with @SenJohnMcCain to allow safe, affordable prescription drugs from Canada.pic.twitter.com/IiImGtsdD0

Enough. 92% of Americans support allowing the federal government to negotiate prescription drug prices for seniors on Medicare Part D. We need to act on my bill (33 cosponsors so far!) to make it happen.pic.twitter.com/rTZYx952TQ
The pharmaceutical manufacturing industry has a lot of influence in Washington. At the same time, prices for four of the nation's top 10 drugs have increased more than 100 percent. #enough
